name: SOG
Prior to Concrete Pour
Materials used complies with design documentation
Datum point used & soffit RLs checked
Grids marked by builder
Confirm As-Built Survey of deck is complete
HOLD POINT - Attach As-Built Survey of Deck
Confirm Form Worker has received As-Built Survey of deck, and has rectified errors prior to any trades commencing on deck
Confirm all beams and decks constructed as per Structural Concrete Profiles
Install slip joints to all load bearing walls and corbels where required
Clean off decks and beams prior to pour, and ensure all exposed off-form soffits are free of any dust, stains and rust marks Hose down if necessary
Check if concrete has falls, and ensure shutters, timbers, spacers are used to create folds where necessary Cross-check the following drawings
Hydraulic Drawings
Architectural Concrete Outlines
Structural Drawings
Check top RLs for all reinforcement, ensuring adequate concrete cover Confirm with Concreter
Confirm that plastic bar chairs are used everywhere, particularly at exposed off-form soffits
Attach Formwork ITP
Attach Formwork Engineer sign off certificate Confirm that certificate references props, braces and compliance with design & AS3610
Attach Formwork Engineer's Certificate
Attach ALL Services Hydraulic ITP (for cast-in elements), include relevant mark-ups below
Attach Precast ITP (for cast-in elements), including relevant mark-ups
Attach Reo Fixing ITP
Attach Principal Structural Engineer Inspection Report, and confirm that all actions are closed out with photos sent to engineer
Attached below as applicable
Attach Post Tensioning Engineer Inspection Report, and confirm that all actions are closed out with photos sent to engineer
Attached below as applicable
Check quantity of concrete required prior to ordering
Total m3 (as measured by Site Engineer)
Total m3 (as measured by Foreman)
Confirm MPa, slump and agg size of concrete prior to ordering
MPa
Slump
Agg
During to Concrete Pour
Ensure concrete truck dockets have correct concrete strength, and attach delivery docket from each batch
Confirm concrete has falls to drainage points in slab
Ensure a representative from each of the following is on site and witnessing the pour
Formworker
Electrician
Plumber
Post Tensioner
Precast Installer
Confirm Form Worker has labour below deck inspecting all joints (particularly at columns & walls) and is immediately cleaning any slurry
Confirm that all protection to precast panels is maintained at all times during concrete pour
After Concrete Pour
Confirm Surveyor is out next day to carry out survey of finished concrete Attach As built Survey Plan
Attached below as applicable
Confirm tolerance of finished concrete surfaces are in accordance with the specifications
Confirm saw joints are installed to engineers requirements
Confirm finish of concrete is adequate for application (broom/trowel/helicopter finish), refer to AS3610
Obtain all concrete tests at 1 day, and attach test results
Test Strength Mpa
Confirm initial stress is conducted day after the pour, after concrete has reached 10MPa on 1 Day results
Obtain all concrete tests at 4 day, and attach test results
Test Strength Mpa
Confirm final stress has occurred after concrete has reached 20MPa, and attach Stressing Records
Attached below as applicable
Obtain all concrete tests at 7 day, and attach test results
Test Strength Mpa
Obtain all concrete tests at 28 day, and attach test results
Test Strength Mpa
Attach Subcontractor ITP - Attached below as applicable
Subcontractor Sign Off
Aland Sign Off
